column4: I have a bit of a weird problem I haven't encountered before.
I need to move my windows partitions across disks.
you can use dd for that
won't that mess up the part tables?
no ... you create the partitions before you copy and then reinstall your boot loader
the drive I'm going to move the windows parts to is bigger than the original. could I just dd the whole drive then resize the partition?
yes, as long as its bigger its ok
if you were moving to a smaller drive you'd have to resize the filesystem before the partition
you can also consider making a backup with dd of the windows partition before the move
the windows part is 160GB, I'm moving to a 250. I am obviously gonna try and boot off the 250 before wiping the 160 :P
I meant ripping out the 160 and trying to boot off ot it and running stuff.
is there a block size that would speed things up? I remember reading 512, but I also remember people saying about 4k blocks a while ago...
i assure you i have no legitimate ties to bs
it's working, the part table has been copied. Thanks. :)
